item.title: Nightcliff Tigers premiership player sues AFL over 'catastrophic' concussion
item.description: Nightcliff Tigers dual-premiership player Trent Melville is suing the AFL in the NT Supreme Court after suffering "catastrophic injuries" in a head clash with another player in 2022.

item.title: Parents say NSW government closing schools without oversight
item.description: As the gates shut at five tiny schools across regional New South Wales, residents fear the loss will be felt far beyond the classroom.

item.title: Arsenal wins FIFA Women's Champions Cup as Matilda Caitlin Foord scores winning goal
item.description: Arsenal have become the first women's world soccer champions, with Matildas star Caitlin Foord clinching the title for the Gunners in extra time.

item.title: Rescued cygnets released back into the wild
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bad Bunny makes Grammys history with Album of the Year win — as it happened
item.description: Debí Tirar Más Fotos is the first Spanish-language record to win Album of the Year at the Grammy awards.

item.title: 2026 Grammy Awards red carpet: Sabrina Carpenter, Olivia Dean arrive in style for the ceremony
item.description: The best and most memorable red carpet looks at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards.

item.title: Today in History, February 2: Balto and the dogs of 1925's Great Serum Run
item.description: Children of an icebound Alaskan town were dying. The journey to save them would be treacherous, freezing, and in these dogs' paws.

item.title: From Sabalenka to Djokovic and 'animals in the zoo', here are the best quotes from the Australian Open 2026
item.description: From tennis stars pushing for more privacy, to Djokovic saying he feels like an old man and a Kyrgios F-bomb, there have been some funny and weird quotes at this year's Australian Open.

item.title: Australian monobob star Bree Walker welcomes pressure at 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: The g-force felt hurtling down the bobsleigh track is the only pressure Bree Walker is feeling despite the Australian speed demon entering the Winter Olympics as one of the gold-medal favourites.

item.title: Grammy winners 2026: Bad Bunny takes home Album of The Year, Olivia Dean Best New Artist
item.description: The 68th Grammy Awards main ceremony has happened in Lose Angeles. See who won what here.

item.title: Corporate Travel Management founder Jamie Pherous resigns amid overcharging scandal
item.description: Corporate Travel Management boss Jamie Pherous has exited from all his executive and board roles as he moves to a "strategic advisory role."

item.title: Found a PCOS 'cure' on social media? It might not be for you
item.description: Advice on how to "manage", "treat" and "heal" PCOS is easy to come by online, but experts say a more personalised approach is usually what's needed.

item.title: Australian woman killed in ski lift accident at popular snow resort in Japan
item.description: Police in Japan confirmed to ABC News the woman’s name is Brooke Day, from Queensland's Sunshine Coast, who was taking a lift at the Tsugaike Mountain Resort when she became caught and suffered critical injuries.

item.title: Grammys 2026: Bad Bunny, Billie Eilish slam ICE at music's biggest awards
item.description: The 2026 Grammys blended protest, celebration and cultural change as artists confronted powers that be, embraced diversity and reshaped the night's biggest awards.

item.title: Mosman Park suspected double murder-suicide prompts calls for greater support for families with high-needs children
item.description: A suspected murder-suicide in Perth has put the spotlight on families with high needs children, with speculation that the Clune family were not getting the support they needed in the lead up to their deaths.

item.title: Slain police officer Neal Thompson's sister says death would be 'too good' for Dezi Freeman
item.description: The sister of one of the police officers shot dead in Victoria's high country last year tells the ABC that death would be "too good" an outcome for the accused gunman Dezi Freeman.

item.title: Properties under threat as uncontrolled Deep Creek bushfire burns south of Adelaide
item.description: An Emergency Warning has been issued for people in the area of a fast-moving, uncontrolled bushfire burning near Cape Jervis, south of Adelaide.

item.title: Is Dezi Freeman dead?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Cory Bernardi to contest SA state election for One Nation
item.description: Former federal Liberal senator Cory Bernardi will lead One Nation's Legislative Council ticket at the upcoming state election in South Australia.

item.title: Dalai Lama's Grammy win slammed as 'anti-China' by Chinese government
item.description: The 90-year-old, who lives in exile from his Tibetan homeland, says he accepts the award with "gratitude and humility" but it has sparked a furious response from China.

item.title: Brisbane baby coffee assault tests Australia-China relations
item.description: Sixteen months after a stranger poured scalding coffee over a baby in a Brisbane park, China's decision to send a working group to Australia marks the first tangible shift in a complicated case.

item.title: In Antarctica's hostile environment, survival experts keep people safe
item.description: Antarctica can be a dangerous place to live and work, but to mitigate the risks, a team of survival specialists is contracted to keep Australia's expeditioners safe on the ice.

item.title: How decluttering your digital streaming subscriptions can save you money this year
item.description: With Australian households now holding an average of 3.7 digital entertainment subscriptions each, doing an audit on what you're using and whether it's providing value can be a good place to start when looking to cut costs.

item.title: If the Reserve Bank starts the year with a rate hike, you can't say it didn't warn us
item.description: Could RBA economists conceivably see inflation returning to target without a rate hike? We'll know this afternoon, and while it's not the dominant view, it's not a fringe one, either.

item.title: Should I take a fish oil supplement for my heart, joints or mood?
item.description: Fish oil is one of the most popular dietary supplements. It's often promoted for protecting the heart, boosting mood, reducing inflammation, and supporting overall health.

item.title: Amber Wraith's parents say medical professionals dismissed her suicidal thoughts
item.description: A hospital has apologised to the parents of 19-year-old Amber Wraith, who took her own life in 2022. Her family hopes her death will prompt changes in the way mental health patients are treated.

item.title: Dezi Freeman search continues as Victoria Police vow hunt 'will not stop'
item.description: Victoria Police is continuing to search bushland in the Mount Buffalo National Park for traces of alleged gunman Dezi Freeman.

item.title: Where do you spend your money? Tell us
item.description: We are keen to understand how the cost of living is being felt across Australia. What are your biggest expenses? Are you making cutbacks? Do you afford yourself luxuries?

item.title: Kangaroo Island's sea lions.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Citizen scientists look for hope as the algal bloom persists
item.description: On Kangaroo Island – where the bloom has washed death ashore for almost a year – a group of citizen scientists are focusing their efforts on "what’s still out there".

item.title: Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance to help rough sleepers through extreme weather
item.description: Tim knows firsthand the struggles of being homeless and navigating the weather, but it's experiences like his which will be the focus of a newly formed Australian Climate and Homelessness Alliance.

item.title: Victorian GPs to be trained to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children
item.description: General practitioners in Victoria will soon be able to diagnose and treat ADHD in adults and children in a move the state government says will cut lengthy wait times and save thousands of dollars.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood to miss start of T20 World Cup, Mitch Marsh shrugs off Pakistan loss
item.description: Speedster Josh Hazlewood will miss the early stages of the T20 World Cup as captain Mitch Marsh shrugs off Australia's lamentable capitulations in their warm-up series in Pakistan.

item.title: Children with brain cancer given hope in trial of personalised vaccines across eight Australian hospitals
item.description: The four-year trial of about 70 children with "dismal prognoses" in eight hospitals across Australia will test the safety and effectiveness of the experimental treatment designed to harness the immune system to attack a child's tumour.

item.title: ACT election data suggests neither Liberal nor Greens voters would want a coalition between the parties
item.description: Greens voters overwhelmingly preference Labor over the Liberal Party across the country — and a look at the data from the 2024 ACT election suggests there's no reason to think that would be different in Canberra.

item.title: Sita Walker's debut novel, In a Common Hour, takes place across a single hour at a state high school
item.description: Sita Walker, an English teacher from Brisbane, explains how she tackled her first work of fiction, set in a single hour at a state high school.

item.title: Deep Creek fire remains uncontrolled after nearing caravan park
item.description: A bushfire on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula has had its warning level again downgraded, but the Country Fire Service says it has burned more than 1,900 hectares and remains uncontrolled.

item.title: Behind the music of hit Australian indie game Hollow Knight: Silksong
item.description: The video game soundtrack will be performed live for the first time by Orchestra Victoria at ACMI in February.

item.title: Townsville health authorities report rise in pregnant women drinking
item.description: A sharp rise in pregnant women drinking alcohol in Australia's largest northern city might be linked to the impact of last year's floods, health authorities say.

item.title: Tributes flow for long-time ABC host James Valentine after cancer forces retirement
item.description: Listeners and former colleagues share treasured memories of a veteran broadcaster who has announced his retirement due to cancer.

item.title: Belinda Bencic and Elina Svitolina make history as two mothers sit in WTA top 10 for the first time
item.description: For the first time in women's tennis, two mothers are ranked inside the world's top 10 simultaneously.

item.title: Rare photo captures Christmas Island flying fox ferrying pup
item.description: Often compared to a "teddy bear", advocates hope the special snap of an endangered flying fox carrying its pup will shine a light on the Christmas Island animal.

item.title: Christmas Island Flying Fox
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Takeaways from the many mentions of Donald Trump in newly released Epstein files
item.description: Donald Trump's name appears many times in the Epstein files — including on an FBI list of men who are named as subjects of "salacious information". So what have we learned about the US president?

item.title: Bright light blazing across Victorian skies believed to be Starlink satellite debris
item.description: Keen observers reported a "massive, bright orange meteor" streaking across the sky, but one astronomer says it was likely to be space debris from a Starlink satellite.

item.title: Sam Kerr is back for the Asian Cup, half a lifetime after winning it as a teenager
item.description: Matildas captain Sam Kerr was just 16 when she helped the team win the Women's Asian Cup — their first, and to date only major trophy. Now she's leading the side at home, ready for another shot at glory.

item.title: Wallabies Rugby World Cup matches revealed against All Blacks, Hong Kong China and Chile
item.description: Australia's home Rugby World Cup campaign will kick off against debutants Hong Kong China rather than bitter rivals New Zealand, who also feature in the same pool.

item.title: Nusantara Beat to bring 'psychedelic' take on Indonesian folk music to WOMADelaide
item.description: All members of Amsterdam-based band Nusantara Beat have Indonesian heritage, so what better way to connect with those roots than through a very different take on the archipelago's traditional music?

item.title: NT to introduce strongest penalty for domestic violence murder in Australia
item.description: Domestic violence killers in the Northern Territory are set to serve longer prison sentences without parole than others charged with murder.

item.title: Model revealed for Thriving Kids, the NDIS alternative for some children with developmental delay or autism
item.description: The federal government has released the model for its Thriving Kids program, aimed at setting up services and supports run by states and territories outside the NDIS.

item.title: Police say Today show host Savannah Guthrie's mother has been abducted
item.description: Police have declared a crime scene after the mother of US TV personality Savannah Guthrie went missing from her home. Here's what we know.

item.title: Teachers in NSW schools face sack for hate speech in classrooms, premier says
item.description: Teachers or school staff found to have breached bolstered NSW hate speech laws face tough sanctions, including the possibility of being fired.

item.title: Greg Roser to serve life sentence as woodchipper murder appeal rejected
item.description: In 2022, Gregory Lee Roser was found guilty of murder after beating a man with a metal bar and then placing his body in a woodchipper.

item.title: Major potato company Zerella plans NT expansion with proposed Katherine seed farm
item.description: Potatoes have not been grown in the Northern Territory at commercial scale for many years but could change if a planned seed potato venture goes ahead.

item.title: Cadia goldmine faces Supreme Court class action over contamination claims
item.description: Landowners in central west NSW are behind an environmental class action against one of the world's biggest goldmines, alleging contamination of more than 2,000 properties.

item.title: One Nation SA candidate Cory Bernardi says party will be the 'strongest voice of opposition'
item.description: One Nation's lead candidate for South Australia Cory Bernardi has taken aim at the "two-party duopoly" in the state, with Pauline Hanson issuing a warning to Labor that her party would be "coming for your seats".

item.title: Former Hobart Matriculation College student sues department, teacher over child sexual abuse allegations
item.description: A woman is suing a former accounting teacher at the then-Hobart Matriculation College, alleging he raped her when she was a 16-year-old student in the 1980s and offered her cash to terminate a pregnancy.

item.title: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25pc as inflation rises
item.description: RBA lifts interest rates by 0.25 per cent, to 3.85 per cent, after inflation rose "materially" in the second half of 2025.

item.title: Child safety officers took no action over 16-month-old’s worsening scabies, inquiry hears
item.description: A 16-month-old child with "persistent" scabies did not receive a medical diagnosis for up to eight months due to inaction by Queensland's child safety department, an inquiry has heard.

item.title: What I wish my manager knew about my mental health
item.description: I've spent my working life in what I like to call the "honesty gap". This kind of creative disclosure became a necessary art form to maintain my work life.

item.title: Perth man accused of backing Bondi attackers facing more firearms charges
item.description: A Perth man who allegedly stated support for the Bondi shooters appears in court to face new firearms charges, with his lawyer flagging a bail application.

item.title: Piper James's family arrives in Australia to farewell 19yo who died on K'gari
item.description: The parents and close friends of Piper James, 19, who died on K'gari (Fraser Island) last month, arrive in Australia to say their final farewells.

item.title: Missing bushwalker David Elliot found after large-scale search in the Blue Mountains
item.description: Authorities have found 71-year-old David Elliot alive following a multi-agency search when he failed to return from a 30-kilometre walk.

item.title: Federal parliament condemns attempted bombing at Perth/Boorloo Invasion Day rally
item.description: Federal parliament officially condemns the attempted bomb attack at Perth's Invasion Day rally on its first sitting day, acknowledging the harm caused to the First Nations community.

item.title: Australian Nurse working in Gaza for MSF says looming ban on aid organisation 'abandons' vulnerable
item.description: Broome nurse Rebecca Smith says a looming ban on Doctors Without Borders due to registration issues will harm the most needy patients.

item.title: SA Parole Board says commissioner made 'error' in overturning Snowtown killer's release
item.description: New documents accuse the Parole Administrative Review Commissioner of making a mistake by not allowing the SA Parole Board to participate in a review of a decision to release Snowtown serial killer James Vlassakis.

item.title: Sydney Mardi Gras pulls plug on party weeks out from parade
item.description: Chief executive of the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, Jesse Matheson, announced the post-parade celebration will not go ahead.

item.title: 'Mass exodus' from Cambodian scam compounds a 'humanitarian crisis'
item.description: Cambodia has witnessed a "mass exodus" from the country's online scam operations in recent weeks amid growing international pressure and the extradition to China of an alleged kingpin.

item.title: 'Spas' and 'saunas' used to reintroduce green and golden bell frogs to the ACT in world-first trial
item.description: Scientists are reintroducing hundreds of green and golden bell frogs into the ACT, nearly 50 years after they became locally extinct.

item.title: Water Corporation makes 'error' in early publication of new desalination plant location in Albany
item.description: The long-anticipated decision on a site for a desalination plant near Albany has been shared on the Water Corporation's webpage in an "administrative error" ahead of the official announcement.

item.title: Two alleged Brothers 4 Life gang members charged with firearms offences
item.description: More than a decade after the gang wreaked havoc on Sydney's streets, two of its alleged members have been charged with firearms offences by the Raptor Squad.

item.title: Commonwealth, Westpac, NAB, ANZ respond to RBA's interest rate hike
item.description: The Commonwealth Bank responds to the Reserve Bank of Australia's decision to increase the cash rate.

item.title: Staff at Tasmania's Ashley Youth Detention Centre 'at breaking point', worker says
item.description: Workers from Ashley Youth Detention Centre in Tasmania's north take "unprecedented" industrial action, walking off the job for two hours over ongoing safety concerns.

item.title: Tasmanian government reveals three-year plan to address violence in schools
item.description: After reports violence on school grounds almost doubled in recent years the Tasmanian government has developed a three-year action plan.

item.title: Central Coast Mariners star Annalise Rasmussen signs with Italian powerhouse Juventus
item.description: A-League leading goal scorer Annalise Rasmussen leaves the competition immediately to join Italian powerhouse Juventus.

item.title: Commissioner slams attempts to use complex needs as 'justification' for Mosman Park murder-suicides
item.description: Australia's disability discrimination commissioner condemns "dangerous narratives" surrounding the deaths of teenage brothers Leon and Otis Clune, saying the burden of disability should never be a justification for family violence.

item.title: To stop the rate hikes, Chalmers might have to ditch the 'I didn't do it' game
item.description: When the news broke that rates would increase, the treasurer's main priority was to prove it wasn't his fault. That won't satisfy voters.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: French police raid X offices in Paris as Elon Musk ordered to face questions
item.description: A widening probe into the social media platform is investigating alleged abuse of algorithms and fraudulent data extraction.

item.title: Luxury Gnarabup Development granted approval by WA Environment Minister Matthew Swinbourn
item.description: A controversial $138 million luxury resort slated for construction in WA's South West is given a long-anticipated green light by the state's environment minister.

item.title: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announces plans to ban social media access for under-16s
item.description: The Spanish PM said his government would begin the process of passing legislation from as early as next week.

item.title: Poland to probe links between Epstein and Russian intelligence
item.description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk says the step has been taken amid growing speculation that "this unprecedented paedophilia scandal was co-organised by Russian intelligence services".

item.title: Son of Norway's crown princess tells rape trial sex was consensual
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby pleads not guilty to four counts of rape and one of domestic violence but guilty to a count of offensive sexual behaviour.

item.title: Officers find signs of forced entry at home of TV host Savannah Guthrie's mother
item.description: Investigators reportedly found evidence of a deliberate night-time kidnapping at the property.

item.title: Thousands of parents seek support as children cannot go to school
item.description: Thousands of Australian parents are struggling with children who cannot go to school. A new podcast and e-book have been released to help support them.

item.title: What could the government do to help battle inflation?
item.description: The federal government has a variety of options available if it wants to do more to stave off inflation, but none are popular.

item.title: Elite women athletes finding ways to work smarter, to help sporting and professional careers
item.description: The sport-work-life balance is a struggle faced by many female athletes, but many are finding meaningful ways to diversify their income to secure their future.

item.title: SA Liberals face three major threats in One Nation, a popular premier and independents
item.description: While South Australia is considered a more moderate state than Queensland or New South Wales, March's state election will still be a chance to gauge the seriousness of One Nation's polling surge and the impact of the Coalition split on the Liberal Party's brand.

item.title: More than 1.5m AI bots are now socialising on Moltbook — but experts say that's not the scary part
item.description: A social network run entirely by AI bots has attracted more than a million users — but experts warn it is not what the bots are saying that poses the true risk.

item.title: How to know if you're experiencing PTSD
item.description: Louise was experiencing nightmares for five years before being diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder.

item.title: Sydney students tackle climate change livability as world records hottest three years
item.description: The designs include cooling devices for street lights, air-purifying pods for train stations and re-imagined bus shelters to improve livability, after the world records its hottest three years ever.

item.title: Boost for development of low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles
item.description: The federal government provides $2 million towards developing low-emissions alternatives to glass wine bottles using materials like seaweed and plant sugar.

item.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
item.description: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.

item.title: Otways residents burnt out of their 'paradise' determined to rebuild home
item.description: The Cochrane family has called the Otways home for more than four decades. Even after fires destroyed their property, they do not plan to move.

item.title: Sydney property manager with alleged ties to 'satanic' paedophile ring denied bail
item.description: Sydney man Colin Milne has been denied bail after "extremely graphic, violent and depraved" material was found on his devices, a court has heard.

item.title: Fire breaks out after alleged ram raid north of Melbourne
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Brazen ram raid and fire at Mooroopna gift shop caught on camera
item.description: Police have released footage of a ram raid and fire at a gift shop in the regional town of Mooroopna near Shepparton, north of Melbourne.

item.title: Donald Trump says Republicans should 'nationalise' US elections
item.description: Donald Trump says he wants Republicans to "nationalise" US elections and has encouraged his party to "take over the voting" in at least some parts of the country.

item.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
item.description: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

item.title: Jill Biden's first husband charged with killing wife in domestic dispute at Delaware home
item.description: William Stevenson is charged with the murder of his wife, Linda Stevenson, at their Delaware home on December 28.

item.title: Dr Karl's How Things Work quiz: How much do you really know about guitars?
item.description: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

item.title: 'Rogue' tour guides threaten Gold Coast glow-worm population
item.description: Last year two operators were fined for running glow-worm cave tours in the Springbrook and Tamborine national parks without the required permits.

item.title: Australia knocked out of under-19 Cricket World Cup by England
item.description: Ollie Peake's hobbling and defiant captain's knock of 100 has proved too little too late to rescue Australia as their reign as under-19 World Cup champions was ended by England in a compelling semifinal in Zimbabwe.

item.title: Deep Creek blaze destroys three structures as CFS concerned about northern flank
item.description: A bushfire on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula has now burnt an estimated 3,200 hectares, with the CFS saying it believes three structures has been lost in the blaze. It is now concerned about the northern flank of the fire as crews come to help from interstate.

item.title: Forestry industry sounds alarm over 'cheap' timber imports landing in Australia and threatening jobs
item.description: Imported timber is coming into Australia at nearly half the price of domestically manufactured products and is increasingly being used in local homes.

item.title: Survival expert praises WA family's calm decision-making during miracle Geographe Bay rescue
item.description: "Outback Mike" Atkinson says the Appelbee family's ability to stay calm and make smart decisions was critical to their survival after they were swept out to sea off Geographe Bay.

item.title: SA Police investigates damage to eight historical graves at Kapunda Cemetery
item.description: Police are appealing for information about the destruction of historically significant graves north of Adelaide.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
item.description: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

item.title: Travel blogger called out for visit to asbestos-ridden former Wittenoom town site with young daughter
item.description: Asbestos disease advocates criticise a Queensland blogger for taking her daughter to one of Australia's most contaminated sites.

item.title: Western Australia's oldest lighthouse at risk from rising sea levels in Geraldton
item.description: The Point Moore lighthouse has kept seafarers safe along the unforgiving Batavia Coast since 1878, but a maritime historian says there needs to be a firm plan to protect it from future erosion and rising sea levels.

item.title: Man to stand trial for allegedly killing Yarrawonga woman Kylie Sanders with car
item.description: Two neighbours of Yarrawonga woman Kylie Sanders tell a court of the night she was allegedly struck by a car driven by Kristopher Castle, who will face trial over her death.

item.title: Ley and Littleproud stand firm ahead of fresh round of Coalition reunion talks
item.description: The Nationals leader has refused to disclose whether he will reject an offering for the Coalition to reunite with a list of conditions, including a six-month suspension from the frontbench for three Nationals senators.

item.title: Eddie Obeid, son Moses and Ian Macdonald lose High Court appeal against conviction for conspiring over coal mine licence
item.description: The High Court throws out an appeal by former New South Wales Labor ministers Ian MacDonald and Eddie Obeid, and Mr Obeid's son Moses, after they were convicted for conspiring over a coal mine licence.

item.title: Queensland Police appeal for information as search continues for missing 70-year-old Dawn Wells
item.description: A large-scale search operation is underway south of Brisbane as police intensify efforts to locate a "beloved community member" who went missing late last year.

item.title: Government eyes off fire sale of historic defence properties around Australia
item.description: The Albanese government has identified 67 defence sites for potential sale, aiming to unlock up to $1.8 billion.

item.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
item.description: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

item.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
item.description: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

item.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
item.description: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

item.title: Child abuse survivors want compensation loophole tightened
item.description: While they welcome proposed law changes, advocates say more can be done to help victim-survivors of child sexual abuse in Australia.

item.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
item.description: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

item.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
item.description: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

item.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
item.description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

item.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
item.description: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

item.title: Teen charged with rape and taking a person by force after Flagstaff Hill park incident
item.description: A 16-year-old boy is facing charges of rape and taking a person by force after the alleged sexual assault of another teenager in Adelaide's south on Saturday night, police say.

item.title: Ski racing event planned for SA's Lake Bonney cancelled amid permit requirement issues
item.description: A ski racing event which was advertised to go ahead this weekend in South Australia's Riverland has been cancelled by organisers at the 11th hour.

item.title: Australian man Michael 'Micky' Hurst dies in Japan while skiing
item.description: Michael Hurst had a medical episode and died on the slopes in Hokkaido, making it three Australians in total that have died in Japan this year.

item.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
item.description: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

item.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
item.description: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

item.title: P-plater intercepted at high speed on Sunshine Motorway, Mountain Creek
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police lecture teen caught driving 189km/h on Sunshine Motorway at midnight
item.description: The teenager on his P-plates was pulled over by police along a Sunshine Coast motorway driving at almost 200km/h.

item.title: Melinda French Gates responds to Bill Gates allegations
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim and India's Narendra Modi named in Epstein files
item.description: The prime ministers of Malaysia and India deny having links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein after their names appeared in a tranche of files released by the US Department of Justice.

item.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

item.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
item.description: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

item.title: Police condemn dozens of e-bike riders for Sydney Harbour Bridge stunt
item.description: Police are combing over CCTV of Tuesday's stunt where officers believe several offences were committed.

item.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
item.description: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

item.title: Humpty Doo locals help relocate crocodile from side of highway
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach
item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
item.description: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

item.title: Mother issues urgent appeal as WA Police call off search for missing son, Zjaequaan Sebasio
item.description: Zjaequaan Sebasio's family and WA Police are urging anyone with information about his location to come forward, after his disappearance almost a week ago.

item.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
item.description: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

item.title: Queensland man who posted photo of a child sex offender online labelled vigilante by magistrate
item.description: The first person charged over misusing the state's new child sex offender registry has been handed a six-month good behaviour bond and accused of vigilantism.

item.title: FOI documents reveal how Anika Wells's New York trip costs escalated
item.description: The final New York travel bill for Communications Minister Anika Wells and her staffer rose $7,000 from an initial booking due to last-minute changes.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Raymond Reddington's trial told wife Sharon Fulton was murdered for insurance money
item.description: Raymond Reddington failed to report his wife missing for several days, changed his story multiple times and wrote a fake confession letter to the state coroner, a Perth court hears.

item.title: Second inquest wraps up into the disappearance of escort Revelle Balmain at Kingsford in 1994
item.description: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
item.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

item.title: Second person charged after death of three-week-old baby south of Brisbane in 2024
item.description: A 24-year-old woman has been charged with cruelty to children following a police investigation into the death of a newborn baby south of Brisbane in 2024.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Labor MP Ed Husic 'uncomfortable' with Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit
item.description: Labor's Ed Husic says it is "hard to reconcile" a visit by Israeli President Isaac Herzog with comments he has made in relation to the war in Gaza.

item.title: Two men face trial over string of alleged public shootings on the Mid North Coast
item.description: A trial has commenced for two men and their alleged involvement in a string of public shootings on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

item.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Ex-prince Andrew leaves Windsor home as British police investigate latest Epstein revelations
item.description: British police are investigating Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor after new files suggest Jeffrey Epstein arranged for a woman to have sex with the former prince at his home at the Royal Lodge in 2010.

item.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers
item.description: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

item.title: Capital gains tax reform among options as Labor weighs housing pitch
item.description: After Jim Chalmers repeatedly refused to rule out changing the capital gains tax discount, a government source told the ABC that changes related to housing were being considered, with capital gains not ruled out.

item.title: At least 162 dead, local king missing after gunmen storm Nigerian village
item.description: Government authorities are blaming "terrorist cells" for the violence in Africa's most populous country.

item.title: At least seven killed by Russian cluster munitions attacks in Ukraine-controlled Donetsk, governor says
item.description: Another round of US-brokered talks on ending the almost four-year war began as Russian cluster munitions killed seven people at a market in Ukraine.

item.title: Marius Borg Høiby, son of Norwegian crown princess, denies rape charges in testimony
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby is pleading not guilty to the most serious charges of rape and domestic violence but admits some lesser charges, including driving too fast.

item.title: Trump administration pulls 700 immigration officers out of Minnesota
item.description: The administration's border tsar says the decision came after local and state authorities agreed to cooperate more closely with its immigration crackdown.

item.title: Ryan Routh sentenced to life in prison for attempted assassination of Donald Trump on Florida golf course
item.description: Ryan Routh will spend the rest of his life behind bars for his 2024 assassination attempt on the then US presidential hopeful.

item.title: Tasmania trials school collaborations to boost students' results under education reform
item.description: As Tasmanian students return to school today, three primary schools will kick off a nation-leading trial the government hopes will stop the state's education system lagging behind the rest of the country.

item.title: Winter Olympics quiz: How well are you prepared for the Games?
item.description: The Winter Olympics gets underway in Milan Cortina this week — but how much do you know about the Winter Olympics? Test yourself in our fiendish quiz.

item.title: Steel businesses forced to close amid surge in cheap imports from Asia
item.description: Australian steel businesses are losing out to importers undercutting them by up to 50 per cent as an urgent probe considers measures to protect the industry.

item.title: A 'ghost airport' and sinkhole highway as Timor-Leste gambles on oil and gas with Greater Sunrise project
item.description: The Greater Sunrise gas project was meant to transform Timor-Leste and bring billions in revenue, but locals are still waiting for the jobs and opportunities that were promised.

item.title: Knives and poison left within reach of kids, prompting closure of day care centre
item.description: Three early learning services, including one at an elite private school, will be closed down today as part of a national push to lift quality.

item.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
item.description: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

item.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
item.description: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

item.title: Psychiatrist of Westfield Bondi Junction attacker referred for review by coroner
item.description: Findings from the coronial inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing have been handed down, almost two years on from the attack.

item.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
item.description: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

item.title: Grandmother removed from Toowoomba birth suite by security
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Man allegedly pretended to fire on people near bridge where Bondi terror attack occurred
item.description: A man accused of mimicking firing on people near the pedestrian bridge where the Bondi terror attack occurred has been denied bail.

item.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
item.description: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

item.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts
item.description: A Queensland government department has urged social media users not to trust AI through the use of an AI-generated image.

item.title: Two months since the social media ban began and teens say it isn't working
item.description: Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s is two months old, but teenagers say they have found ways around it.

item.title: High Court to consider limiting CSL Australia's liability for accident that sunk two tugboats in Tasmania
item.description: A convention on laws of the high seas will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as the owners of the MV Goliath take on the Tasmanian Ports Corporation over an incident where the ship hit and sank two tugboats.

item.title: What are data centres and what do they mean for regional Victoria?
item.description: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

item.title: Live: Big Four banks quiet on savings rates two days after RBA hike
item.description: Three of the Big Four banks say they're still deciding how to pass on the RBA's rate hike to savers. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Police launch investigation into sudden death in Toowoomba
item.description: Police have closed part of Bell Street and the Toowoomba bus terminal car park on Chronicle Lane in Toowoomba's CBD as part of the investigation.

item.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases
item.description: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Welfare concerns for missing man Luke Hazelwood last seen outside of Lancelin Sands Hotel
item.description: Luke Hazelwood was last seen outside the Lancelin Sands Hotel on December 24, but his family are holding out hope for his safe return.

item.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
item.description: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

item.title: NRL rookie Sebastian Su'a poised for breakout year after injury-plagued 2025 season with Dolphins
item.description: The work ethic of a former Test fast bowler and the mentoring of an elite prop are inspiring Dolphins rookie Sebastian Su'a's NRL quest.

item.title: Sydney man, 19, charged over alleged threats to kill Israeli president
item.description: Darcy Tinning was arrested by AFP officers on Wednesday and charged with making a threat to kill an "internationally protected person".

item.title: Esperance locals slam WA government decision to block opposition leader from visiting high school
item.description: Community leaders in Esperance say the decision to block Opposition Leader Basil Zempilas from visiting the local high school highlights the government's disregard for badly needed repairs.

item.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
item.description: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

item.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
item.description: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

item.title: How Super Bowl-bound Aussie Michael Dickson became NFL's best punter
item.description: Michael Dickson has become one of the finest punters in the NFL, and could become just the second Australian to play in a victorious Super Bowl team.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: Australian Charities and Not-for-profits Commission investigates 'apocalyptic Christian cult' Shincheonji
item.description: The Australian Charities and Not-for-profits Commission says it is investigating the charity status of Shincheonji, which featured prominently in the Victorian parliamentary inquiry into cults and fringe groups.

item.title: Australians in Japan say ski fields are safe after spate of deaths
item.description: Australians working in Japan's ski fields say while the sport has unpredictable risks, there are ways to be prepared.

item.title: Owner of Arnie the German shepherd sentenced over death of dog and misleading police
item.description: A Queensland man has been ordered to serve community service hours after pleading guilty to killing or wounding his dog Arnie, who he left in his car to die, and to misleading police by claiming it had been stolen.

item.title: Two people in custody after alleged Huon Valley home invasion
item.description: Police take two people into custody in relation to an alleged early morning home invasion and firearms theft in the Huon Valley.

item.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
item.description: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

item.title: Mr Clark says national and international specialists are working together to identify the victims.

item.title: Breaking: Invasion Day rally attempted bombing declared terrorist act
item.description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.title: Private health insurers take aim at rising specialists fees
